intro: Hilliella shuangpaiensis, commonly known as the Shuangpai hilliella, is a rare flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its compact shrub form with evergreen leaves. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically pink or white in color. It thrives in acidic, well-drained soils and is often found in mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
